title: The winning driver of the Mexico GP will be joined on the podium by their Formula 1 CAR
text:
Formula 1 fans are used to seeing the winning driver of a Grand Prix celebrating on a podium after the end of a race, but the ceremony in Mexico this weekend will shake up the system.

Whichever driver wins the Mexico GP will rise up to the podium with their Formula 1 car, with the tournament organisers known for putting on a spectacle.

Lewis Hamilton is one of the favourites to win the race that could see him clinch the world championship in Mexico, which means the British driver could cap his sixth victory by celebrating with his Mercedes car.

Lewis Hamilton is one of the favourites to win the Mexico GP and could win his sixth world title

According to Motorsport.com, staff taking the vehicle to a ramp that leads to a a hidden platform situated near the podium, which will then hoist the car up.

The top three drivers will then be celebrated in front of the crowd as normal, as the third and second placed racers come onto the stage, before the winning car and its driver are elevated above them in a spectacular fashion.

Hamilton enters the pit lane in the first Mexico Grand Prix practice session ahead of Sunday

Hamilton needs to beat his Mercedes team-mate Valtteri Bottas by 14 points in order to clinch his sixth world title on Sunday.

Doing so will put him just one title behind legendary driver Michael Schumacher.

If Bottas were to win in Mexico his chances of lifting a first ever F1 world championship would be kept alive so long as Hamilton finished fourth or lower.
